com.fujitsu.xml.xlink.processor
Class XLinkProcessor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.fujitsu.xml.xlink.processor.XLinkProcessor
public class XLinkProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

XLink processor class that provides a function for analyzing XML documents covering all elements defined with XLink.
The XLink processor provides the following two functions:

  • Function that constructs an XLink data model from an XML document containing an XLink description
  • Function that obtains information from a constructed XLink data model
Examples of use of these two functions are shown below:
Construction of XLink data model
An XLink data model is constructed using one of the following methods:
  • XLinkProcessor.createXLinkDataSet(String)
     [Example]
 // An XML document URI is prepared.
 String uri = "http://anyhost/any.xml";

 // An XLink processor instance is created.
 XLinkProcessor xLinkProcessor = new XLinkProcessor();

 // An XLink data model is constructed.
 boolean flag = xLinkProcessor.createXLinkDataSet(uri);
  • XLinkProcessor.createXLinkDataSet(Document, String)
     [Example]
 // XML document URI is prepared.
 String uri = "http://anyhost/any.xml";

 // A freely selected XML parser is used to construct a DOM from the URI.
 Document doc = AnyParser.createDocument(uri);

 // An XLink processor instance is created.
 XLinkProcessor xLinkProcessor = new XLinkProcessor();

 // An XLink data model is constructed.
 boolean flag = xLinkProcessor.createXLinkDataSet(doc, uri);
Information acquisition from constructed XLink data model
An usage example of the methods shown below is given here.
  • getResourceURI(Locator)
  • getHubDocument()
  • getSimpleLinkEndingResourceObjects(Node)
  • getSimpleLinkEndingResourceURI(Node)
  • isLinkBaseStartingResource(Document)
  • isSimpleLink(Node)
  • isStartingResource(Node)
  • processLinkBase(Node)
In the example, the following processing is executed:
  1. An XLink data model is constructed from an XML document.
  2. Elements that are link start resources in the XML document are fetched sequentially, and information is output on the basis of information defined with XLink. 
 [Sample]
 // An XML document URI is prepared.
 String uri = "http://hostname/anypath.xml";

 // An XLink processor instance is created.
 XLinkProcessor xLinkProcessor = new XLinkProcessor();

 // An XLink data model is constructed.
 boolean flag = xLinkProcessor.createXLinkDataSet(uri);

 // The document node of the XML document is obtained.
 Document document = xLinkProcessor.getHubDocument();

 // An iterator defined in the DOM Level 2 Traversal and Range 
 // Specification is created.
 NodeIterator iter =
   ((DocumentTraversal)document).createNodeIterator(
     document, NodeFilter.SHOW_ELEMENT, null);

 // Elements in the document are accessed sequentially by using the 
 // created iterator.
 while (Node node = iter.nextNode()) {

   // Each element is checked to see if it is a link base start resource.
   if (xLinkProcessor.isLinkBaseStartingResource(node)) {

     // The link base is analyzed.
     xLinkProcessor.processLinkBase(node);

   // Each element is checked to see if it is a simple link start resource.
   } else if (xLinkProcessor.isSimpleLink(node)) {

     // The link ending resource is obtained.
     NodeSet targets =
       xLinkProcessor.getSimpleLinkEndingResourceObjects(node);
     if (targets.getLength() != 0) {
       printNodeSet(targets);          // Method (optional) that displays 
                                       // node sets
     } else {

       // If empty NodeSet is obtained, ending resource URI information 
       // is obtained.
       String endingResourceURI =
         xLinkProcessor.getSimpleLinkEndingResourceURI(node);
       printString(endingResourceURI); // Method (optional) that displays 
                                       // character strings
     }

   // Each element is checked to see if it is a link start resource.
   } else if (xLinkProcessor.isStartingResource(node)) {

     // A link ending resource with show attribute value "new" 
     // and actuate attribute value "onLoad" is obtained.
     LocatorList targetLocators =
       xLinkProcessor.getEndingResourceLocators(
         node, Arc.SHOW_NEW, Arc.ACTUATE_ONLOAD);
     for (int index = 0;
          index < targetLocators.getLength();
          ++index) {
       // Locator information holding information about the link ending 
       // resource is obtained.
       Locator locator = targetLocators.item(index);

       // The URI of the link ending resource is obtained from the 
       // locator information.
       String endingURI =
         xLinkProcessor.getResourceURI(locator);
       printString(endingURI);         // Method (optional) that 
                                       // displays character strings
     }
   }
 }

Constructor Detail

XLinkProcessor

public XLinkProcessor()
               throws XLinkException
Constructor.
Method Detail

setMessageReporter

public void setMessageReporter(XLinkMessageReporter messageReporter)
Set a message handler.
Messages, including error messages, may be issued during XLink processor or XLink data model operation with the application.
Set the message handler to which these messages are to be reported.
When null is specified, no message handler is set.
A default message handler is set with an XLink processor.
See XLinkMessageReporter for information on the default message handler.
Parameters:
messageReporter - Message handler.

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.Object value)
An property is obtained.
Parameters:
name - Property name.
Nothing is set if null or empty string is set.
value - Property value.
Nothing is set if null or empty string is set.

createXLinkDataSet

public boolean createXLinkDataSet(java.lang.String systemid)
An XLink data model is constructed.
An XLink data model is constructed from a specified XML document.
The specified XML document is set as a hub document.
Parameters:
systemid - Absolute URI or local file path name of the XML document.
If a partial file path name is specified as a local path name, the absolute URI obtained by converting the full file pathname, including the current work directory, is used.
Returns:
If the XLink data model is constructed successfully, "true" is returned.
If the XLink data model is not constructed successfully, "false" is returned.

createXLinkDataSet

public boolean createXLinkDataSet(Document doc,
                                  java.lang.String systemid)
An XLink data model is constructed.
An XLink data model is constructed from a specified XML document.
The specified XML document is set as a hub document.
Parameters:
doc - Root of the DOM tree constructed from the XML document.
systemid - Absolute URI or local file path name of the XML document.
If a partial file path name is specified as a local path name, the absolute URI obtained by converting the full file pathname, including the current work directory, is used.
Returns:
If the XLink data model is constructed successfully, "true" is returned.
If the XLink data model is not constructed successfully, "false" is returned.

appendToXLinkDataSet

public boolean appendToXLinkDataSet(java.lang.String systemid)
The specified XML document is added to the XLink data model.
If this method is called before construction of the XLink data model, it operates in the same way as createXLinkDataSet(String systemid).
Parameters:
systemid - Absolute URI or local file path name of the XML document.
If a partial file path name is specified as a local path name, the absolute URI obtained by converting the full file pathname, including the current work directory, is used.
Returns:
If the additional construction to the XLink data model is successful, "true" is returned.
If the additional construction to the XLink data model is unsuccessful, "false" is returned.

appendToXLinkDataSet

public boolean appendToXLinkDataSet(Document doc,
                                    java.lang.String systemid)
The specified XML document is added to the XLink data model.
If this method is called before construction of the XLink data model, it operates in the same way as createXLinkDataSet(Document doc, String systemid)
Parameters:
doc - Root of the DOM tree constructed from the XML document.
systemid - Absolute URI or local file path name of the XML document.
If a partial file path name is specified as a local path name, the absolute URI obtained by converting the full file pathname, including the current work directory, is used.
Returns:
If the additional construction ito the XLink data mode is successful, "true" is returned.
If the additional construction to the XLink data model is unsuccessful, "false" is returned.

getDataSet

public XLinkDataSet getDataSet()
An XLink data set is obtained.
The XLink data set which is constructed as an XLink analysis result and as the root of the XLink data model is returned.
If the XLink data model has not been constructed or was not constructed successfully, null is returned.
Returns:
The XLink data set is returned.

getHubDocument

public Document getHubDocument()
A hub document is obtained.
The root (document) of the DOM tree constructed from the hub document is returned.
The hub document is the first processed document, and XLink processing is always started with the hub document. If an XLink data model has not been constructed or was not constructed successfully, null is returned.
Returns:
The root (Document) of the DOM tree constructed from the hub document is returned.

isSimpleLink

public boolean isSimpleLink(Node node)
A node is checked to see if it is a simple link start resource.
The specified node is checked to see if it is a simple link start resource, and the result is returned.
Parameters:
node - Node to be checked.
Returns:
When the specified node is a simple link start resource, "true" is returned.
For other cases, "false" is returned.

getSimpleLinkEndingResourceObjects

public NodeSet getSimpleLinkEndingResourceObjects(Node node)
A simple link ending resource is obtained.
A node set holding the link ending resource of a simple link whose link start resource is a specified node is returned.
If the link ending resource has not yet been analyzed, a empty node set is returned. For such a case, the URI of the link ending resource can be obtained using getSimpleLinkEndingResourceURI().
Parameters:
node - Node that is a simple link start resource.
Returns:
A node set holding the ending resource of the simple link traversal destination is returned.
If the node indicated by the argument is not a simple link start resource or the ending resource of the simple link has not yet been analyzed, a empty node set is returned.

getSimpleLinkEndingResourceURI

public java.lang.String getSimpleLinkEndingResourceURI(Node node)
A URI indicating a simple link ending resource is obtained.
The URI of the link ending resource of a simple link whose link start resource is a specified node is returned.
Parameters:
node - Node that is a simple link start resource.
Returns:
The URI of the link ending resource of a simple link starting with a node specified in the argument is returned. If the simple link ending resource is undefined, a empty string is returned.

getEndingResourceLocators

public LocatorList getEndingResourceLocators(Arc arc)
A locator information list holding information about the link ending resource specified in arc information is obtained.
Parameters:
arc - Arc information.
Returns:
The locator information list holding the locator information about a link ending resource specified in arc information indicated by the argument is returned.

getEndingResourceLocators

public LocatorList getEndingResourceLocators(Node node,
                                             short show,
                                             short actuate)
A locator list holding a link ending resource is obtained.
The locator list, which holds the link ending resource of a link starting with the specified node and is found in link declaration information holding the show or actuate attribute of the specified arc type element, is returned.
Parameters:
node - Node that is a start resource.
show - Constant corresponding to an arc type element show attribute.
Either of the following values is set:
  • Arc.SHOW_EMBED
  • Arc.SHOW_REPLACE
  • Arc.SHOW_NEW
  • Arc.SHOW_OTHER
  • Arc.SHOW_NONE
actuate - Constant corresponding to an arc type element actuate attribute.
Either of the following values is set:
  • Arc.ACTUATE_ONLOAD
  • Arc.ACTUATE_ONREQUEST
  • Arc.ACTUATE_OTHER
  • Arc.ACTUATE_NONE
Returns:
The locator list holding the ending resource list for links obtained from link declaration information satisfying the above condition is returned.

getResourceObjects

public NodeSet getResourceObjects(Locator loc)
A node that is a link resource is obtained.
A node list holding a node that is a resource in the specified locator information is returned.
If the link resource has not yet been analyzed, a empty node set is returned. For such a case, the URI of the resource can be obtained using getResourceURI().
Parameters:
loc - Locator information.
Returns:
The node set containing the node used as a resource is returned. If the corresponding node is not present, a empty node set is returned.

getResourceURI

public java.lang.String getResourceURI(Locator loc)
A URI indicating a resource is obtained.
The URI held in a locator specified in the argument is returned.
For locator information indicating a simple type element or information created from a resource type element, a empty string is returned.
The resource can be obtained using getResourceObjects().
Parameters:
loc - Locator information.
Returns:
The absolute URI character string indicating the resource of locator information is returned. This absolute URI contains fragmentation identifier.
Either of following cases, it returnes empty string:
  • If locator information indicates simple type element itself
  • If locator information is created from resource type element
  • If locator information is created from locator type element that has no href attribute

isLinkBaseStartingResource

public boolean isLinkBaseStartingResource(Node node)
A node is checked to see if it is a link start resource in link declaration information that expresses a link base.
The specified node is checked to see if it is a link start resource in link declaration information that expresses a link base, and the result is returned.
Parameters:
node - Node to be checked.
Returns:
When the specified node is a link start resource in link declaration information that expresses a link base, "true" is returned.
For other cases, "false" is returned.

processLinkBase

public void processLinkBase(Node startingResourceNode)
A link base is analyzed.
If arc information whose specified node is a link start resource holds link base specification in arcrole attribute, link ending resource in the arc information is analyzed as a link base document and added to an XLink data model. If the specified node is not a link start resource or has been added, no operation is performed.
Parameters:
node - Node with which link base analysis starts.

isStartingResource

public boolean isStartingResource(Node node)
A node is checked to see if it is a link start resource.
The specified node is checked to see if it is a link start resource, and the result is returned.
Parameters:
node - Node to be checked.
Returns:
If the specified node is a link start resource, "true" is returned.
If the specified node is not a link start resource or it is null, "false" is returned.

hasStartingResourceAncestor

public boolean hasStartingResourceAncestor(Node node)
A node is checked to see if it is in the start resource contents.
Parameters:
node - Node to be checked.
Returns:
If the node is a start resource or under a start resource, "true" is returned.
For other cases, "false" is returned.

getSingleSimpleLinkArc

public Arc getSingleSimpleLinkArc(Node startingResource)
Simple link arc information is obtained.
The arc information about a simple link whose start resource is the specified node is returned.
Parameters:
startingResource - Node that is a simple link start resource.
Returns:
The arc information satisfying the condition is returned.
If corresponding arc information is not present, null is returned.

getOnLoadArcs

public ArcList getOnLoadArcs(Node node)
Search is done for arc information with actuate attribute value "onLoad".
A link in which the specified node is a link start resource is searched for arc information whose constant for indicating the actuate attribute is Arc.ACTUATE_ONLOAD.
Parameters:
node - Node which is the link start resource.
Returns:
An arc information list holding the found arc information is returned.

getOnRequestArcs

public ArcList getOnRequestArcs(Node node)
Search is executed for arc information with actuate attribute value "onRequest".
A link in which the specified node is a link start resource is searched for arc information whose constant for indicating the actuate attribute is Arc.ACTUATE_ONREQUEST.
Parameters:
node - Node which is the link start resource.
Returns:
An arc information list holding the found arc information is returned.

getFragments

public NodeSet getFragments(java.lang.String systemid,
                            java.lang.String xptr)
A fragment identifier is analyzed as an XPointer, and a corresponding node is obtained.
A node set holding a node obtained as the result of XPointer analysis of a specified fragment identifier for an XML document with a specified URI is returned.
Parameters:
systemid - Absolute URI or local file path name of the target XML document.
If a partial file path name is specified as a local path name, an absolute URI obtained by converting the full file pathname, including the current work directory, is used.
xptr - Fragment identifier (XPointer character string).
Returns:
The node set holding the analysis result is returned. If an invalid systemid is specified, the fact is reported to the message handler and then a empty node set is returned.
A node set holding only document nodes obtained from a specified systemid is returned in the following cases:
  • The fragment identifier is null.
  • The fragment identifier is a empty string.
In the following case, a node set holding only document nodes is returned after reporting the error:
  • The fragment identifier contains an error.

getFragments

public NodeSet getFragments(Document doc,
                            java.lang.String xptr)
A fragment identifier is analyzed as an XPointer, and a corresponding node is obtained.
A node set holding a node obtained as the result of XPointer analysis of a specified fragment identifier for a specified document node is returned.
Parameters:
doc - Target document node.
xptr - Fragment identifier (XPointer character string).
Returns:
A node set holding the analysis result is returned.
If the document node is null, the fact is reported to the message handler and then a empty node set is returned.
A node set holding only document nodes is returned in the following cases:
  • The fragment identifier is null.
  • The fragment identifier is a empty string.
In the following case, a node set holding only document nodes is returned after reporting the error:
  • The fragment identifier contains an error.

processOnRequestLinkbase

public boolean processOnRequestLinkbase(java.lang.String systemid)
A link base is analyzed dynamically.
The link base analysis result is added to a constructed XLink data model.
If it has already been added, nothing is added.
Although a fragment identifier is contained in the analysis target URI, the entire document, including the subtree, becomes an XLink target.
Parameters:
systemid - Absolute URI or local file path name of the XML document to which the link base analysis result is to be added.
If a partial file path name is specified as a local path name, an absolute URI obtained by converting the full file pathname, including the current work directory, is used.
Returns:
When the link base analysis terminates normally, "true" is returned.
For other cases, "false" is returned.
If completed analysis is specified, "false" is also returned.
